title: More Sona Nerfs

embed.description: This is a WORK IN PROGRESS POST - Today' s Patch out but the PBE still down ] The PBE has been updated! Continue reading for more information! ( Warning: PBE Content is tentative and iterative - what you see may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers!

body:
I really need some clarification on this. Sona is in a good spot right now. She brings a good amount of utility and damage to her team. She is a great poke supp, and synergizes very well with poke comps.

However, she is the squishiest champion in the game atm, or at least in the bottom 5. With no runes or masteries, she has less health than a melee minion.  On top of that, she is very low range. She has to be very close to all of her teammates to get 100% effectiveness out of her abilities, and is very, very easy to pop in teamfights or skirmishes.

Riot's nerfs last patch were unjustified, and this only makes it worse, both literally and figuratively. 

Now, to me, the thing that stands out to me about Sona is her Q. I love it. It can be used as long range poke, or, a hard engage nuke. The original cast is pretty weak, but can hit 2 targets at 700 range. However, if she gets in auto range, this can be combined with her passive, dealing quite a bit of damage. This can be very very risky however, as anyone with a brain will jump on you, and you will die. If you go for the passive poke at the wrong time, you will get 1-shotted. This is even more true against supports like Zyra, Leona, Thresh, and Blitz, as the will laugh as you get 100 - 0 with their abilities alone.

Now, the reason I am writing this is because they want to Nerf Sona's passive Q powercord. The nerf? 50% of powercord damage reduced to 40%. Stack that on with last patch's nerfs, and this is a serious problem. 

The thing that bothers me even more is that at the same time, Elise and Hecarim are geting buffed. Now, dont get me wrong, I think these champs need a buff, but they are already seeing lcs play. Guess who has not seen a single game this year? (Correct me if im wrong), Sona.

Now to me, Nerfing a non-competitive pick, and buffing already dominant competitive picks sends some very strong messages that really just say, and I quote "Ma Esports". The best part is, I never see anyone say "Damn that Sona was OP". You guys just keep nerfing her. Over and Over again. 

Her scalings arent good, her heal is mediocre, and her speed-boost is non existent early game. She has to consistently put herself in danger to be effective, and, praise the sun, she actually gets huge rewards for being played properly! I don't see the problem Riot has with Sona, but she needs to be left alone. It is okay for a supp other than Thresh and Janna to be played, I promise!

I demand justice. A symphony of justice, for our fare Maiden of the Strings. I call out to you, my fellow Sona enthusiests, re-direct your pitchforks from the rework, and let us try to salvage what remains.

...what.

Relic Shield heal: 40 HP (2 charges, 60s CD)
Hymn of Valor: 40 dmg (50 dmg if you have Spellthief's)
... if you get in an auto-attck, the combo is [110 damage](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/8td19lAN-more-sona-nerfs?comment=001500010000)
Aria of Perseverance: 30 HP (10s CD)

So, Leona with Relic Shield healing per second:  40 HP / 60s = **2/3 HP/s ~ 0.7 HP/s**
Sona healing per second: 30 HP / 10 s = **3 HP/s** (note: healing increases based on missing HP, this is the worst-case scenario)

Leona with Face of the Mountain: 50 HP / 30s = **5/3 HP/s ~ 1.7 HP/s**
Sona healing with level 5 W: 110 HP / 10s = **11 HP/s** (note: healing increases based on missing HP, this is the worst-case scenario)

I'm talking about the lvl 1 - 3 sustain. If you keep poking her, she'll can heal it with the passive of the relic shield, since Sonas W isn't healing that much with one or two points.
And I wasn't talking about the late game, I was talking about laning phase/pre lvl 6.
Yeah, Sona can keep poking, but don't forget that Leona can do her healing for free, if she uses the passive wisely. Sonas heal costs quite alot of mana as well, so if I would play against an enemy sona, and know that she's oom, she'll be pretty worthless if Leona tries a engage.

In my experience, Sona's healing is much, much more powerful than Relic Shield since *it increases based on how much health the target is missing*. It's like a reverse execute!

I generally remedy the high mana consumption by having 3 MP5 seals and speccing MP5 in the utility tree, which gives me enough MP5 that I can spam Q almost on CD and use W occasionally, and only go OOM if the enemy jungler comes to visit and I have to QWEohgodADCplzdon'tdie repeatedly.

it heals the base amount + 50% if the target is left with 0% health.
Relic shield heals the same amount, or actually the double amount of Sonas current heal. 

lets see..

point 1 Sona heal 30 + 0.2 ap (assume 10 ap) = 32 hp get healed on cast
If her target is left with 50% health, the heal increase would be about 8 hp.
Sona would heal 40 hp if her target is left with 50% health

Relic shield heals 30 hp per charge. If someone would use two charges at once, it would heal 60 hp. 

So, does Sonas heal still outscale relic shield?

And if you really want to see how much the final item heals vs Sonas 5 point heal..

point 5 Sona heal : 110 + 0.2 ap (assume 60 hp) = 122 hp on cast
If her target is left with 50% health, the heal increase would be about.. 30 hp
Sona would heal 152 hp if her target is left with 50% health

Face of the mountain has max 4 charges and heals 50 + 1% max health of the champion (let's assume it's Leona, she's lvl 10 and has only the FotM)
Leonas max health: 1250 + 300 = 1550 hp.

Leona would heal 50 + 15 health = 65 health per charge.
If she would use her 4 charges, it would heal 260 hp.

So? You still think Sonas heal is so strong?
FotM heals much more than Sonas current heal, and can compete with actual support heals like Nami and Taric (note: tarics heal does also target himself and ally, like Sona)

Yeah, in situations where no minions are around, Sona has a advantage, but FotMs heal is great for stalling in lane, mostly if lane minions are coming.

The problem is, Riot can't with honest words give any proper or logical reasoning.  Every Riot word thus far since the original discussion in April has been pure propaganda.  They're not going to stop lying to us now, this far in.

Fact of the matter is that Riot regrets creating Sona and wish for her continuity to be completely removed from League.  There was no other reason for them to "rework" (nerf) a healthy C-class champion to an F-class one.  Then there was even less logic to this and the last nerf being done to said F-class champ.

The dead horse isn't decaying fast enough, so they're beating it to speed up the process.

It simply isnt fair. I love Sona. I love her playstyle, her design, her lore, all of it. 

Back when all of my friends where playing this, and I was a scrub console peasant, I never saw anything about league that interested me. But then, I saw it. I saw an amazing fanart with Sona in it. I wanted to know who it was, and alas, I finally gave league a try. Sona isnt the sole reason I started playing, but she gave me the push needed to download. She was my main all the way to level 30. 

Seeing her trampled on like this is depressing. They might as well delete her. At least then I wont have the temptation to lock her in.

There's nothing they can say to the Sona community at this point that wouldn't cause fires and pitchforks to be raised. They know that. They're not subjecting themselves to it. It's basically them saying, we're deleting her, we're not listening to your input (even though we said we would) and we're not responding (even though we said we'd improve communication.) It's a damn good thing the other divisions aren't like this. The art divisions I would say are almost a little too interactive.
